7.code:
from django.contrib import admin
from django.urls import path, include
from mybudgetcontrol.urls import urlpatterns as project_urlpatterns

def main():
    admin.autodiscover()
    app_name = "mybudgetcontrol"

    # Customize the Django default admin site (optional)
    # Default: admin/ 
    admin.site.site_header = f'MyBudgetControl dashboard'
    admin.site.site_title = app_name
    admin.site.index_title = 'Dashboard'

    urlpatterns = [
        path('admin/', admin.site.urls),
        path('', include(project_urlpatterns))
    ]

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

from django.apps import AppConfig

class MyBudgetControlConfig(AppConfig):
    name = 'mybudgetcontrol'
    verbose_name = 'My Budget Control'

from django.urls import path, include
from . import views, admin
urlpatterns = [
   path('', views.home, name='Home'),
   path(r'admin/', admin.site.urls),
   # Other URL patterns for Balance Tracker, Reports, Settings 1, Help  etc.
]

sys.path.insert(0, os.path.abspath('.'))
from django.core.management import execute_from_command_line
execute_from_command_line(sys.argv)

import os
sys.path.insert(0, os.path.abspath('.'))
from django.core.wsgi import get_wsgi_application
os.environ.setdefault('DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE', 'someproject.settings')
application = get_wsgi_application()

from django.apps import AppConfig

class HelloWorldConfig(AppConfig):
    default_auto_field = 'django.db.models.BigAutoField'
    name = 'hello_world'

from . import views
urlpatterns = [
   path('', views.home, name='home'),
]
